item.title: About The Brit
item.description:
About The Brit

Human projects include Amazing Capitals life guides for expats. Amazing Concepts country insights for foreigners and Village Green, creative escapes for European children.

item.title: Village Green
item.description:
Village Green

In brief, the idea for this charitable concept was inspired by Malcolm Kenneth Green, a fine man and my father. Throughout my life, whenever he stood peacefully somewhere, children would walk up to him and take hold of his hand. Yes, he was both humble and gentle.

item.title: Germany's Great
item.description:
Germany's Great

Written by Garry, last edited on Germany celebrated (sort of) twenty five years of reunification on October 3 2015 with all its successes and challenges. So what makes Germany great? Why are many millions of foreigners from across the globe attracted to settle here?

item.title: Ad-free art on the underground: Düsseldorf's 'pure' new metro line
item.description:
Ad-free art on the underground: Düsseldorf's 'pure' new metro line

"It was an unusual project," says Berlin-based artist Heike Klussmann, a lead designer of the new U-Bahn line, which opens on Saturday in the German city of Düsseldorf. Fifteen years in the making, the Wehrhahn metro line consists of six new stations running east to west beneath the city centre, collaboratively designed by architects, artists and engineers.

item.title: The comprehensive guide for expats in Düsseldorf with the answers is Amazing Dusseldorf | Amazing Capitals
item.description:
The comprehensive guide for expats in Düsseldorf with the answers is Amazing Dusseldorf | Amazing Capitals

For expats (expatriates) international residents in Düsseldorf the most popular expat guide Amazing Dusseldorf is great for foreign business visitors too

item.title: Düsseldorf
item.description:
Düsseldorf

A man once told me long ago that he always tried to visit one more country than his current age. I met him when he was 80 years of age and on his way to Israel. Magnificent! I wonder where he is now at 120?

item.title: No title
item.description: "Hello Sonny"... those were the last words my father ever spoke to me. Two words with so much meaning, such intensity. And love. You're a fine man, Dad, thanks for the path you created and everything you are.
